org.catechis.admin
Class FileUserOptions

java.lang.Object
  org.catechis.admin.FileUserOptions
All Implemented Interfaces:
UserOptions
public class FileUserOptions
extends java.lang.Object
implements UserOptions

This class gets a users options as well as adds a new option to every users option file, which is only to retrofit older users after (File)UserUtilities is changed..

When an admin does retrofit users options files, to see the new option on the admins page, the jsp file must be altered to display the new option, and the properties file needs to include a labed in various languages for this optiob.

Ideally, new options should be added in the (File)UserUtilities class.

getJSPOptions

public java.util.Hashtable getJSPOptions(java.lang.String user_id,
                                         java.lang.String jsp_name,
                                         java.lang.String subject)
This method gets an options file associated with a jsp file stored in the users folder like this //options/jsp_options/.options.

This id is a string so that this method is backwards compatible with users whos folders are named instead of in a folder named after their id.

Specified by:
getJSPOptions in interface UserOptions

getUserName

public java.lang.String getUserName(java.lang.String user_id)
The users name is stored in a file /files/admin/users/.usr.

This id is a string so that this method is backwards compatible with users whos folders are named instead of in a folder named after their id.

Specified by:

Load a users options file and get the Exclude Time Vector (ELTVector) then erase the old word's last test dates and word's next test date reading and writing folders and regenerate the files based on the ELTVector.

deleteDir

private boolean deleteDir(java.io.File dir)
Deletes all files and sub-directories under dir. Returns true if all deletions were successful. If a deletion fails, the method stops attempting to delete and returns false.

getELTVector

public java.util.Vector getELTVector(java.util.Hashtable user_opts)
ELT = Exclude Level Times. These are integers represending multiples days where a word should be excluded from testing. This utility method returns a Vector of four elements corrisonding to reading levels 0-3, and their multiplies which are stored in a users option file.

Specified by:
getELTVector in interface UserOptions
Parameters:
user_opts -
Returns:
